name: a(n) is the number of squarefree composite k with lpf(k) = prime(n) such that m <= Omega(k), where lpf = A020639, m = floor(log k / log lpf(k)), and Omega = A001222
comment: a(n) is the number of terms in A377713 with least prime factor prime(n).
formula: a(n) = length of row n of A377792.
example: In A377713, there are terms k with smallest prime factor prime(n) as follows:
Prime(n)  | a(n) | k such that floor(log_lpf(k) k) <= Omega(k)
mathematica: AppendTo[w, NextPrime@ Last[w] ]; m *= p; c++,
w = Append[w[[;; -3]], NextPrime@ w[[-2]] ]; m /= p] ],
author: _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 07 2024

name: Irregular triangle where row n lists squarefree composite k with lpf(k) = prime(n) such that m <= Omega(k), where lpf = A020639, m = floor(log k / log lpf(k)), and Omega = A001222.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16116 (rows n = 1..10, flattened)
example: In A377713, there are terms k with smallest prime factor prime(n) as follows:
Prime(n)  | b(n) | k such that floor(log_lpf(k) k) <= Omega(k)
mathematica: AppendTo[w, NextPrime@ Last[w]]; m *= p; Sow[s],
w = Append[w[[;; -3]], NextPrime@ w[[-2]] ]; m /= p] ],
author: _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 07 2024
